author: Paul Rankin
method: Place the pepper, garlic, oil and thyme into a  saucepan and cook gently for ten minutes over a low heat. Season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper and add the olives.  Meanwhile, mix together the yoghurt and cucumber in a bowl, set aside. For the hummus, place all the ingredients except the oil into a food processor and blend to a paste. Add the oil with the blender running to create a paste to your desired consistency. Decorate a plate with the pitta fingers, add the roasted pepper, hummus and yoghurt dip and serve.
ingredients: 1 roasted red pepper from a jar, sliced,  1 clove garlic, sliced,  2 tbsp olive oil,  sprig of thyme,  handful of pitted olives,  sea salt and freshly ground black pepper,  110g/4oz of Greek yoghurt,  ¼ cucumber, grated,  2 pitta breads, toasted and cut into strips,  400g/14oz can of chickpeas, rinsed and drained,  2 garlic cloves,  ½ tsp sesame oil,  1 tbsp sesame seeds,  ½ lemon, juice only,  sea salt and freshly ground black pepper,  olive oil, to taste
